review: Bought this as a inexpensive pair of jeans to wear it to places that are prone to damaging good clothes. But the whole color fading issue had me worried. So i tried what the internet suggested to lock in the color dyes, -same  for any new pair of jeans.. soak in a tub of water with a cup of vinegar for a few hours before first use. Rinse it.. off course the excess dye will come out like any jeans, but thankfully the black remained black after the vinegar treatment for roughly 2-3 hours.Zip quality is a very rough . But I hope both the black color and the zip stays the same for atleast 6 months. Anything more and i will be be super happy. One should not realistically expect any more from something at this cost. But the black color is impressive and I was surprised the whole locking in the colors with vinegar method worked. I think i will pick up a blue one next and keep these two for the not so savory places i visit.However if paying 700 bucks for pair of jeans that may not really last for a couple of years is not your cup of tea.. There are much cheaper brands availble that are more solid in build.. But they have terribly unsmart cuts and stiches.. this one looks smart, and I dont mind paying 700 bucks or I think 799 bucks just for its style and color tone, for something that last only a year or perhaps if you take care of it.. more?!Buy it for the good fit.. and color.. not for long lasting.
